chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.   The cash bond has been applied towards the costs.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  If probation is revoked the jail credit of 470 days shall first be applied towards Taylor County Case No. 16CF16.     Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114.

superMiscConds.notes:
All costs have been paid in full from DE's bond.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of the restitution victims and/or governmental entities of the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey P. Mertens appeared by video means from Jackson Correctional Institution with Attorney Stephen Willett in person in Taylor County.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Willett.  Statement by Jeffrey Mertens.  Court orders that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to 470 days sentence credit in 16CF16.  02CF41 - 2 additional days of sentence credit shall be given.  Clerk   17CF98 - the clerk shall amend the judgment of conviction as requested by DOC.   Mr. Mertens also indicated that he wanted the JOC to be changed to show that he is eligible for the substance abuse program.  Court finds Mr. Mertens is eligible for the substance abuse program in 16CF16 and 16CF31.  Clerk to amend JOC accordingly. - rt

of February 20, 2019 Sentencing Hearing

02:25 PM Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Willett requests correction to revocation packet as to pg. 24 as to correct maximum penalties on Ct. 1 on 16CF31.  Atty Tlusty corrects as to pg. 5 and does not object to correction.  Court agrees.  Argument on sentencing. Court takes judicial notice of Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. No objection.  DE makes statement on sentencing.  Atty Tlusty states additional argument on sentencing.  Court imposed the following sentence on 16CF16: Ct. 1 - 8 years Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. Conditions: Any supervision fees or any other obligations that were previously ordered.   Court imposed the following sentence on 16CF31: Ct. 1 - 3 years Wisconsin State Prison System with 1.5 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to 16CF16 and any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. Conditions: Any supervision fees or any other obligations that were previously ordered.  973 days of sentence credit to be added to 16CF16.  17CF98 - Atty Willett requests to adjourn Jury Trial due to surgery.  Court states there is speedy trial demand.  Atty Willett requests to withdraw speedy trial demand. DE makes statement agrees to withdraw.  No objection by the State.  Court reschedules Jury Trial.  Jury Trial scheduled April 8, 2019 at 8:30 a.m. set as #1. ba

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court dismisses and read in count 2. Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Kirkpatrick.  Statement by Jeffrey Mertens.  Court orders withheld sentence probation five years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Bond to be applied towards all costs in all of the cases.   470 days sentence credit.   If probation is revoked the jail credit is to be applied to 16CF16 first.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
